attributes.action: To allow Christopher Maurice Brown (singer) to be allowed into the UK
attributes.background: Since the incident in 2009 when Chris Brown wrongfully abused his ex girlfriend Rihanna, he was no longer allowed to enter the UK, almost 10 years later he still isn't able to visit our country. He has paid his debt to society and publicly apologised. He has suffered enough. Bring BROWN BACK!
attributes.additional_details:
This happened near enough 10 years ago! 
We need his talent to be aloud back in the UK! To be allowed to perform.

attributes.action: Make Houses of Parliament alcohol free.
attributes.background: The issue of sexual harassment at work is a matter of concern, not least within Parliament. We believe Parliament should lead the way in ending this abuse. Many complaints are reported to arise in situations where alcohol is involved. Parliament is a place of work and there is no need for alcohol.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1293902/MPs-drunk-hour-drinking-session-voted-Budget.html The culture of drinking within the Houses of Parliament is a national disgrace. Ending the sale of alcohol, both at bars and with meals, would not only help reduce sexual harassment, but help members stay alert and able to conduct business on behalf of the tax payer. Parliament is a place of work, and there is no need for alcohol to be served.

attributes.action: Require HMRC to separate out the cost of Brexit on personal tax statements.
attributes.background: The UK Government is taking us out of the EU whatever the cost. During the referendum campaign, much was made of the cost of membership of the EU. There will be costs to leave the EU - public sector time, research and consultancy fees, legal costs, repayments, and so on. These should be identified.
attributes.additional_details: The 'Vote Leave' campaign advertised a fee of £350m per week going to the EU (£18.2bn per year), while the ONS calculates the true value to be £9.9bn per year (http://visual.ons.gov.uk/uk-perspectives-2016-the-uk-contribution-to-the-eu-budget/). Brexit is predicted to cost an additional £60bn (https://www.ft.com/content/51a19263-9788-37b9-a9fa-8cd307265edf). This will have consequences for government spending and tax rates - taxpayers must be able to understand where their money is being used.

attributes.action: Increase the sentence for failure to stop after a fatal road traffic collision
attributes.background: My brother, Andy Lindup, was killed in a hit and run in Dec 2016. By the time the driver was arrested, it was too late to breathalyse him and gather evidence for a charge of dangerous driving for which he could have faced up to 14 years in prison. Instead he got just 6 months for failure to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
The sentence for failing to stop after a fatal road collision must be made equal to the maximum sentence for death by dangerous driving. Otherwise, there is absolutely no incentive for drivers to stop. Why would anyone stop if they knew they could face 14 years as opposed to just 6 months? My family will never know if the driver who killed my brother was under the influence or not. If he wasn’t, maybe he would have stopped if the law was different. If he was, then the law has let him escape justice.
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5168331/Family-man-killed-hit-run-call-law-change.html

attributes.action: Put General Practitioners on the Home Office's 'Shortage Occupation List'
attributes.background: GP Practices in rural areas struggle to recruit doctors, forcing many surgeries to close. There are many GPs from outside the EU who would like to work in the UK. However, Practices can't offer them a job without going though the visa bureaucracy, and the NHS is losing many good doctors as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Lincolnshire patients are suffering due to the lack of GPs [1]. In Lincoln, surgeries are closing as a result [2]. The Home Office have been asked to put GPs on the 'shortage occupation' list, but have refused to do this. This is unacceptable.   
[1] http://lincolnshirereporter.co.uk/2017/09/i-dont-bother-trying-anymore-man-with-heart-disease-says-queues-outside-gp-are-now-a-joke/
[2] http://thelincolnite.co.uk/2017/09/lincoln-gp-surgery-close-merge-new-plans/

attributes.action: Make it mandatory all processed meat products carry a Government health warning
attributes.background:
In 2015 the World Health Organisation classified all processed meat products as group 1 carcinogens after extensive studies proved them to be a known cause of colorectal cancer
To date the Government has not acted responsibly and  failed to make this information widely known to the general public.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like to see a proper campaign to enlighten the public of the health risks if they are consuming these products, starting with making it mandatory to include a Government health warning on the packing of all processed meat products and removing all processed meat products  from schools. 

Link to the World Health Organisation information regarding processed meat:
http://www.who.int/features/qa/cancer-red-meat/en/

attributes.action: Correct the flaws in our First-Past-The-Post voting system.
attributes.background:
Add score voting to the FPTP ballot; to correct its flaws, improve on its ability to produce strong governments, and strengthen its direct constituency link

Stand by 2011 AV referendum result by keeping the first past the post selection of MPs defining FPTP, but address the issues that lead to it
attributes.additional_details:
FPTP Currently: a voter marks one candidate, voters' marks are tallied, and the candidate with the highest total wins

W/ Score Voting: a voter scores each candidate, voters' scores are tallied, and the candidate with the highest total wins

A minor ballot change can fix all of FPTP's flaws AND add to its strengths

Simple guide: endfptp.reddit.com/6xtbgh

Comprehensive guide: rangevoting.org

2017 GE Simulated w/ Score voting: endfptp.reddit.com/6lctda

Score vs. PR: endfptp.reddit.com/6gur0e

attributes.action: The Scottish Government should be called the Scottish Executive.
attributes.background: The description of Scotland's devolved administration as a 'Government' causes confusion about its constitutional remit, which has led to considerable over-reach by devolved bodies into reserved matters. This duplication is contentious, costly, and detracts from the good governance of Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: We petition Parliament to repeal section 12 of the Scotland Act 2012.

attributes.action: Maximum 30 day wait for anyone needing counselling for mental health issues
attributes.background: As someone who has battled mental health issues for the last 20 years. I’m sick of going to my G.P. and being told there’s a minimum 3 month waiting list. This isn’t good enough. I’m requesting that a maximum wait of 30 days be instilled.
attributes.additional_details:
It is wrong that depending on where you live, decides how quickly you receive NHS support for mental health. It is grossly under funded and massively under resourced.
5 times in the last 10 years I have been told there is a minimum 3 month wait for help, this is in the Richmond (York’s) constituency, one of the wealthiest in the country.
So I want a maximum 30 day wait.

attributes.action: Proscribe Britain First
attributes.background: Britain First are an ultra far right group, they have a paramilitary wing called the "Britain First Defence Force". They organise ‘days of action’ that target a specific demographic namely Muslims, they use these days of actions to harass Muslims in shops, on the street or in mosques.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of its campaigners have also been banned from every mosque in England and Wales for their actions.
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/britain-first-banned-from-all-mosques-in-england-and-wales-after-police-take-out-injunction-a7196831.html

attributes.action: Introduce proper effective regulation of implantable medical devices
attributes.background:
Repeated scandals involving medical devices show that the current regulatory system is not fit for purpose
Tighten regulation of medical devices so that:
- High risk medical devices have clinical trial evidence at the time of approval
- There is a publicly accessible registry for such devices
attributes.additional_details:
There have been multiple scandals over implanted medical devices, including pacemakers, TVT meshes, breast implants, & metal hip joints.

Current rules mean manufacturers don't have to produce clinical trial evidence before CE safety marking & use in patients. Equivalence allows a new device to be waved through if a manufacturer declares it similar to an existing product, even if those other products have had safety concerns.

Reference: BMJ Open 2017;7:e017125
doi: 10.1136/bmjopen-2017-017125

attributes.action: Introduce the British Empire as a mandatory part of the Key Stage 3 curriculum
attributes.background: Currently the British Empire is an optional and small footnote on the History syllabus. A thorough and balanced mandatory module should be introduced to proportionally reflect the impact the Empire has had on our diverse UK population, and its impact on public attitudes towards immigration and race.

attributes.action: Stop plans to exempt vehicles more than 40 years old from roadworthiness tests
attributes.background:
The Department for Transport has announced that it intends to exempt most vehicles that are more than 40 years old from annual roadworthiness tests (MoT) from May 2018.

The Government should reconsider this and aim for all vehicles to be given independent annual inspections for safety reasons.
attributes.additional_details: When respondents to the Government’s consultation were asked whether these vehicles – including many classic cars  and motorcycles – should be exempted from MoT tests, more than half were opposed. The DfT's own figures indicate that only 6% of pre-1960 vehicles, already exempt, are voluntarily tested. If this is also the case for vehicles over 40 years old when the exemption is introduced then there is a risk that safety-critical faults on more than 293,000 vehicles will not be detected.

attributes.action: Debate effect of pumping out brine at Fleetwood on marine life and livelihoods
attributes.background: Consent has been given for brine to be pumped out at Fleetwood.  Pumping will continue for years, whilst they build underground gas storage caverns. Local experts have concerns about the possible effects on our delicate marine ecology and on local livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details:
There are concerns relating to conservation; the food chain; fishing industry; tourism; polluted water from Fleetwood dock; and the accuracy of dispersal modelling.

We call for a parliamentary debate on the brine discharge and on whether the benefits of this project for the UK outweigh the possible negative impacts on the local area.

attributes.action: Make parking of ICE vehicles at EV charging points a more serious offence
attributes.background: Dedicated charging points for EV across the country are regularly and deliberately occupied by conventional ICE vehicles. This causes unnecessary stress for EV drivers as, unlike conventional cars, electric vehicles require charging points and attached parking place to be able to move.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, there are more than 100k plug-in vehicles in the UK. These cars require charging points to be able to move and in most cases such points are placed within parking areas for conventional cars. Although clearly marked as such, many of the points are obstructed by ICE vehicles, deliberately parking in EV-dedicated slots. This became a chronic symptom across the country and causes unnecessary stress for drivers. Local councils are not doing enough to protect rights of EV community.

attributes.action: The undersigned demand the following terms are included in any UK Brexit deal.
attributes.background: To include a deduction for the value of the UK’s share of funds held by the European Investment bank, EU loans, EU properties, cash and any other EU investments and assets, the total of which will offset any financial payment(s) made to the EU in whatever form as part of our final Brexit agreement.

attributes.action: Give the blood bike community section 19 exemptions for blue light runs
attributes.background:
There are 27 blood bike groups up and down the UK that respond to a call for help every night from their local NHS.
They willingly transport urgent medical supplies from hospital or hospital overnight free and voluntarily.
Help us get the emergency delivery to its destination sooner with S19
attributes.additional_details:
At present if the selected rider/driver receives a Blue Light call they can not:
• exceed the speed limit
• treat a red light as a give way
• go to the right of a keep left barrier
• Use audible warning equipment

E.G.
it's 2am, nothing on the road, they still have to:
• travel along EVERY road at the speed limit
• stand at a red light with nothing using the green light.

If we are granted section 19's that few minutes could be the difference in saving a life someday

attributes.action: Use Foreign Aid budget for the NHS, Adult Social care and the elderly.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget currently stands at £13bn. This is far too high. We believe charity begins at home and that the Foreign Aid budget should be used for the NHS, Adult Social care and the elderly who have been the backbone of our country.

attributes.action: Consultants or GPs to do PIP, DLA and ESA assessments for people with IBD
attributes.background: To get medical assessments conducted by qualified consultants and GPs who understand patients’ conditions in Crohn’s and Ulcerative Colitis, which can give accurate information about their disabilities to support their claims for PIP, DLA and/or ESA.
attributes.additional_details: I suffer from Ulcerative Colitis, ADHD, OCD, Anxiety and Depression Disorder and Cluster 4 which means I can't deal with day to day life. I'm on a drug called Infliximab Infusion which is for my IBD and have to have it every 6-8 weeks in hospital in the Infusion Unit. This suppresses my immune system,  which means I am prone to infections. I have been rejected twice by PIP saying my IBD and Mental Health Issues don't affect me in my day to day life; I am now waiting for a tribunal.

attributes.action: Urge the Government to support the construction of a Sudbury bypass.
attributes.background: The town of Sudbury, Suffolk has suffered from heavy congestion for too long, hampering the development of the town, causing dangerous levels of pollution and reducing the living standards of its residents.
attributes.additional_details:
The Sudbury Bypass Campaign already has a strong initial business case, the support of Suffolk County Council, the New Anglia Local Enterprise Partnership and the Haven Gateway Partnership.

This petition asks that the Government provides support for the construction of a Sudbury bypass, including any necessary funding, to improve the future of the town and surrounding areas.

attributes.action: Negotiate with the EU the possibility of direct EU citizenship for UK nationals
attributes.background: 16,141,241 voters chose to remain in the EU in 2016's referendum - nearly 4 times the size of the Republic of Ireland's population. Their rights as EU citizens are being taken away. Negotiate with the EU the possibility of these individuals' maintaining their EU citizenship should they desire it.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens of the EU benefit from many rights that UK nationals are at risk of losing as a result of Brexit. These include the right to live, travel, work, or study without hindrance in 27 other countries. European citizenship exists as a complement to citizenship of a member state. If the UK ceases to be an EU member state, these rights will be lost. Negotiate the possibility of retention of these rights for those UK nationals who still wish to be EU citizens, rather than citizens of nowhere.

attributes.action: Protect vulnerable debtors in enforceable Taking Control of Goods ​Regulations
attributes.background: Taking Control of Goods National Standards contains guidance for Enforcement Agents when dealing with vulnerable debtors - this guidance is unclear and results in vulnerable people being exploited unnecessarily and new Regulations to clarify this should be debated by Parliament
attributes.additional_details: Give stronger support to vulnerable council tax debtors than provided in T​aking Control of Goods​, National Standards for Enforcement Agents​ paras 70-78 Vulnerable Situations. Local Authority should be advised not to send bailiffs to collect the tax from households which have no income due to zero hours contract, benefit sanction or Universal Credit. Bailiffs should be required to report those circumstances​ in households they call on ​to the local authority with out taking any further action.

attributes.action: Rescind Donald Trump's state visit invitation.
attributes.background: After Donald Trump was invited to make a state visit to the UK he used a terrorist attack in London to make political capital and to undermine the Mayor of London's response to that attack. The UK government should make its displeasure clear by rescinding his state visit invitation.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been other examples of Donald Trump's actions since the invitation was issued that show he does not deserve this honour:

- He said that there were "many fine people" participating in a neo-nazi / white supremacist rally.
- He equated the actions of those at the rally with the people protesting it.
- He declared transgender people unfit to serve in armed forces in any capacity.

The UK government should demonstrate a break from these values by rescinding the state visit invitation.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed Warrington Western Link
attributes.background:
We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government and Dept of transport NOT to fund the Warrington Western Link route. The negative impacts to the people of Warrington are too severe to warrant the;
- cost
- disruption
- increase in traffic
- destruction of greenbelt land
- increased air pollution

attributes.action: Make General Practice recognised as a specialism in the UK
attributes.background: General practice is the foundation of the NHS, yet even though doctors undergo rigorous training to become a GP, including an exit exam (MRCGP) they are still not recognised as specialists. The UK is an outlier compared to other countries across the globe.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently UEMO (the European Union of General Practitioners/Family Physicians) called for all European countries to recognise the speciality and the statement has the support of other European 
medical organisations.

In August 2016 the RCGP released this press statement http://www.rcgp.org.uk/news/2016/august/gps-must-be-recognised-as-specialists-in-general-practice-say-rcgp-and-the-bma.aspx , but to date there continues to be no movement on their call.

attributes.action: Change law and tax rules to ensure equal pay for equal work for agency workers
attributes.background: Many workers work through agencies using umbrella companies to handle pay. This is used to pay workers less by avoiding Employers NI. ENI is deducted from workers’ wages. This petition seeks a law to prevent workers getting less take-home pay than directly employed people doing work of equal value.
attributes.additional_details: There must be equal take-home pay for equal work for agency workers. Umbrella companies say that workers agree to work like this, but we know in the industry that this is not so and that workers are not given a choice and must go umbrella if they want to get employment. This is a widespread practice that is  hurting the pockets of vulnerable workers.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of live small animals in pet shops and garden centres in the UK
attributes.background: Shops should no longer be allowed to sell living creatures. It is too easy for people to make rash decisions & impulse buy animals when they're displayed like products. If the animals weren't on display, people would have to do more research & seek out a breeder or rescue for their new pet.
attributes.additional_details: Animals sold in shops or garden centres are most at risk of abandonment or left to charities. When sold to anyone who can pay, this can result in unprepared, incompetent, or abusive owners. Often stored out of sight, these animals are kept in small crates with little space or care. Animals are often depressed, mis-sexed, sick, or injured.  Leading to unexpected litters & vet bills, while animals when bought for children or as a gift on a special occasion, are often given up or abandoned.

attributes.action: Give all Ancient Woodland statutory legal protection.
attributes.background: Ancient Woodland is a nationally important wildlife habitat in its own right, acting as a natural flood defence air filter and carbon store, while providing homes for species that depend on it for survival. Once it's gone it's gone, legal protection should be brought in line with SSSIs as a minimum.
attributes.additional_details: With 13% of the UK's landmass covered in woodland, compared to the EU average of around 35% we are significantly lagging behind our European counterparts. We must protect our ancient woodlands as part of a program of woodland expansion that will help us to reduce the concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere and slow the progress of rainwater, reducing flooding downstream. Expanding will help reverse the decline of woodland species as highlighted by the UK State of Nature Report 2016.

attributes.action: Stop The Genocide In Myanmar - UK Government Please Help!
attributes.background: Hundreds have been forced to flee their villages as the emergency situation in Myanmar has worsened. Urgent needs of displaced people include water, hygiene facilities, food & shelter.
attributes.additional_details: The Burmese government, along with radical Burmese Buddhists, are attempting to exterminate the Rohingya people through direct violence and denial of rights. the Rohingya people have been denied basic human rights both inside their native Burma and have been subjected to routine forced labour, and have been resettled on unfarmable land while their previous lands have been confiscated and given to Buddhist settlers from elsewhere Violence and oppression in Burma have forced many Rohingya to flee.

attributes.action: End the new flight restrictions on passengers travelling from Northern Cyprus
attributes.background: In light of recent security policies in the USA, the UK has followed suit by insisting that passengers in transit from Ercan airport to Stansted (or U.K.) undertake extensive additional security checks at Istanbul airport.
attributes.additional_details:
Many passengers have been flying to London via a touch-down in Turkey for over 40 years without incident. Therefore This is perceived as a political decision. It has nothing to do with security. Ercan is one of the safest airports in the world.

This situation impacts the elderly and disabled, driving passengers south to Larnaca or Paphos airports.

We urge the UK government to reverse this policy immediately.

attributes.action: Full labelling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients or use in production
attributes.background: Full labelling on ALL goods regarding animal ingredients e.g. animal fat in fabric softener and isinglass (swim bladder of fish) in wine production.  A simple label that there IS or IS NOT any animal ingredient or derivative used at any stage of manufacture without constantly searching the internet.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like it made mandatory that all products ie, tyre, decorating materials, household cleaners, garden products, clothes and footwear, to be clearly marked that they contain animal derivatives such as gelatin, animal based glues, and shellac.  In other words, everything that is sold in the UK. The Co-op already state on the front of their cleaning products etc. whether there is no animal ingredients.
Many items marked cruelty free still contain animal ingredients which causes confusion.

attributes.action: Mandate that patients are told if their NHS referral is to a private provider.
attributes.background: NHS patients are often not informed when their referral is to a private and not an NHS provider. They are entitled to choose who provides their care and should not be referred to the private sector by default. Patients have a choice under the NHS Constitution and they should be informed of this.
attributes.additional_details: A relative needed an Opthalmology opinion and so was referred. The referral choices were to one private company with a choice of five venues. An NHS option was not given despite being available locally. This was because a block of care had been purchased from this private company in advance. A referral to the NHS would have meant a second payment for this care. Challenge by the relative resulted in an NHS appointment. This practice is unfair to both patient and the NHS and should stop.

attributes.action: Make Work Related Stress  absence over 7 days reportable under RIDDOR 2013
attributes.background: Work related stress is the most reported injury between workers. I would love to see all absence for work related stress reported to the HSE under the Reporting of Injuries,Diseases and Dangerous Occurrences Regulation 2013. Make stress an occupational disease, make stress RIDDOR 2013 reportable
attributes.additional_details: 12.5 million working days lost due to work - related stress, depression or anxiety in 2016/17 sourced information from HSE....so much productivity lost

attributes.action: Do extra checks in scans during pregnancy to check for vasa previa placentas.
attributes.background: Vasa previa placentas are rare 1:2500 pregnant women have them therefore they do not check for them as standard however detected before labour mum and baby have 99% chance of survival. Undetected if mum goes into labour baby's chance of NOT surviving is between 55-95%.
attributes.additional_details: This is when the vessels that feed the baby oxygen are on the outside of the placenta so when mum dilates and baby's head moves down the vessels burst starving baby of oxygen (with 2mins to get baby out) and causing mum to haemorrhage. Detected, mum will be hospitalised from 29 weeks and have a c section between 35-36 weeks. Undetected results can be devastating. A few extra minutes on a scan could save mum and baby's life.

attributes.action: Change the law so that rape can be classed as a terrorist offence
attributes.background: Targeting women & children with the heinous act of rape based on race, colour or religious, non religious & political beliefs, is a conscious form of illicit psychological warfare, genocide, &/or so-called ethnic cleansing as recognised by the UN Security Council under the 1820 resolution.
attributes.additional_details:
Amnesty International reports that all around the world military commanders are using rape to 'terrorize' humiliate and demoralize communities. Amnesty International, OHCHR, UNICEF, Military Chiefs, Govts all understand and know this undeniable fact.

These same tactics are being used in the UK. We need to recognise and understand that these are acts of terrorism.

attributes.action: Formally recognize Jerusalem as the capital city of Israel
attributes.background: Given the recent statement from the President of the USA, now would be a good opportunity for the UK to join the USA in recognizing Jerusalem as the Israeli Capital. To resolve the Palestine-Israel issue the UK Gov't must take steps which will pressure both sides to enter into proper negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
Statement by President Donald Trump - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-42259443

Prime Minister May's statement against recognizing Jerusalem as the Israeli Capital - https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pm-statement-on-us-decision-to-move-embassy-to-jerusalem-6-december-2017

Prime Minister Netanyahu's Response to President Donald Trump's Statement -http://www.pmo.gov.il/English/MediaCenter/Spokesman/Pages/spoke_statement061217.aspx

attributes.action: Introduce an animal abuser registry in the UK
attributes.background: Animal abuse should be recorded in a database similar to ViSOR, in the UK. A registry should be introduced that records the name, date of birth, offence, conviction date and expiration date of all known animal abusers, preventing them from adopting a pet or working with animals in any capacity.
attributes.additional_details: There is a strong correlation between animal abuse and domestic violence between humans. Furthermore, there are countless recorded cases of serial killers having tortured animals before moving onto crimes against humans. With this in mind, the registry would not only protect animals and pets from abuse, but also, potentially, humans. The USA is already taking steps to enforce these laws in several areas, although Tennessee is the only place to implement a state-wide registry.

attributes.action: Dogs under S1 DDA should automatically be entitled to interim exemption
attributes.background: The Dangerous Dogs Act (s1) prohibits ownership of certain dogs. Any dog suspected to be a banned breed it is likely to be seized by the police and kept in a police kennel. If the court finds the dog is a banned breed but it is not deemed a danger, it may be exempted (subject to restrictions).
attributes.additional_details: The police have the power to issue an interim exemption pending the courts decision. However, this is entirely at their discretion and how this is dealt with varies between forces. Where a dog is only being pursued as a result of how they look, this interim exemption should be automatic (where the restrictions can be put in place and adhered to). Spending long periods in kennels can detrimental to the welfare of a dog and the owner.

attributes.action: Reject HS2 Phase 2a proposed scheme to save Blithbury Reindeer Lodge
attributes.background: Blithbury Reindeer Lodge will be severely affected or face closure due to the current HS2 phase 2a proposed scheme.
attributes.additional_details: Blithbury Reindeer Lodge was set up by Mr Swinnerton in 2007.  Under the current scheme, the lodge would be affected by a purchase of land and the relocation of the B5014. All the land is utilized for grazing and relocation is not an option. Realignment of the road will cause disruption, noise and air pollution. If the land is acquired the lodge will have no option but to close.

attributes.action: Stop development on Green Belt land and prevent de-designation of Green Belt.
attributes.background: We call upon Parliament to fully support measures to stop development on green belt land and to prevent de-designation of green belt land, to halt the coalescence of villages such as Kings Langley into neighbouring towns thus permanently losing their character.
attributes.additional_details: Green Belt is under increasing threat and it is time to say 'enough' - no more building on precious open spaces between towns and villages because it is irreplaceable.  There are other places to build than on the Green Belt - keep it untouched for the generations to follow.

attributes.action: Reinstate the rail link from Poulton le Fylde to Fleetwood Lancashire
attributes.background: The rail link was closed in 1980’s. There is a need in Fleetwood for decent transport links on the grounds of deprivation and poor economy. People have to travel for an hour during rush hour to get to the nearest station 5 miles away. Commuter rail is essential to rebuild our economy.
attributes.additional_details: Fleetwood is on a peninsula and since the 1970’s has been in decline. We now have a division one football club, the only one with no rail link, and things are on the up though people cannot get in and out of town for university and work due to its positioning on the Fylde coast. We are a beautiful town with an amazing coastline which we cannot share properly due to poor transport links. Most of the track is in place just no trains running. Fleetwood has great potential please help it thrive.

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to stop the annual Yulin Dog Eating Festival
attributes.background:
Thousands of dogs are annually tortured to death during the Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, boiled to death, beaten, burned and dismembered while still alive. 
Yulin began in 2009; it is not tradition. Nor is there a valid comparison between the eating of beef or lamb and dog-meat.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2016 11 million people worldwide signed a petition against dog slaughter at Yulin. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/yulin-dog-meat-festival-ban-petition-11-million-sign-slaughters-thousands-animals-china-a7081521.html
Despite this the festival went ahead in 2017. 
Unlike cattle, dogs/cats have a greater understanding of suffering:
https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/animal/article/identifying-and-monitoring-pain-in-farm-animals-a-review/CECEC60BB101FF770ED7E594E0CCE8BA

attributes.action: Reduce student loan interest to an affordable 1% over base rate.
attributes.background: With the current punitive and profiteering rate of RPI + 3% typical loans of £50k require a salary of £55k pa just to pay the £3,000 interest. The rate charged is excessive and leaves a lifetime millstone for most graduate leavers. Give the majority an attainable goal and a sense of hope!

attributes.action: Investigate whether David Davis lied to Parliament about Impact Assessments
attributes.background:
David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out impact reports detailing the financial impact of Brexit on the UK economy.

However these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2016, Secretary of State for Exiting the EU David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out “about 57 sets of analyses”. These would detail the financial impact of Brexit on sectors vital to the UK economy.
 
On 6th December 2017, David Davis admitted that these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.

attributes.action: The MCA must send launch request to RNLI when fishing boats are reported overdue
attributes.background:
Fishing is the UK's most dangerous peacetime occupation. The Marine & Coastguard Agency must immediately task RNLI lifeboats when 
1) A fishing vessel is reported overdue by a harbour or family member. 2) A distress signal is received.
attributes.additional_details: Any delay in the MCA tasking the RNLI can mean the difference of life and death for a fisherman. There is not an RNLI crew in the country that would mind being called to station to launch, only later to be stood down because all is well with a vessel. A change of protocol to require the MCA to immediately task the local RNLI crews is needed urgently. Worse things happen at sea and even short delays can mean the difference between the rescue of a survivor, or the recovery of a body.

attributes.action: Provide short term emergency parking stickers for IBD sufferers.
attributes.background: I’m trying to be a voice for sufferers of Crohn’s and Colitis which are the two forms of inflammatory bowel disease. One of the main symptoms is an urgent need to use the toilet which, due to general poor accessibility to public toilets can often results in unnecessary incontinence.

attributes.action: Make the teaching of Sexual consent  compulsory In schools
attributes.background:
Rape, Sexual abuse and harassment are prevalent issues effecting our society. 

More needs to be done to tackle these issues. Children need to be taught what constitutes consentual sex and what actions are considered Sexual abuse and harassment as part of the compulsory national curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
The teaching of consent in schools is currently not compulsory. 

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence since. 

Some references:
https://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/mar/09/sexual-consent-lessons-government-criticised-pshea-inadequate

attributes.action: Make the maximum wait for CAMHS assesments no more than 6 months.
attributes.background:
Currently the wait to get a child assesed for autism is almost 1.5 years
This is not acceptable and can have serious implications on the child's mental health, as well as causing serious problems within the home. This petition is to try and persuade the government to reduce these waiting times.
attributes.additional_details: Waiting times are taken from friends currently on the waiting list in Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Put Stonehenge into special measures Remove Stonehenge from EH Management
attributes.background: Since splitting with Historic England, English Heritage has commercialized Stonehenge to the extreme introducing a 'Pay to Pray' Policy at Solstices and priced Tourism out of reach for the General Public to whom it was left, and supported unsuitable road improvements in the World Heritage site.
attributes.additional_details: They have rejected the advice and concerns of UNESCO, Senior Archaeologists, Historians, Druids, and Environmentalists. This shows they are not fit to manage the 'Jewel in the Crown' of a World Heritage site.

attributes.action: Voluntary Right to Buy (VRTB) Scheme for Housing Associations - Update Needed
attributes.background: This petition calls for an update from UK government on the Voluntary Right to Buy Scheme which proposes for the Right to Buy to be extended to Housing Association tenants in England (as pledged in Conservative Manifesto in 2015, piloted with 5 associations and gaining Royal Assent in 2016).
attributes.additional_details:
The government should confirm intentions to deliver the scheme nationally as pledged in 2015. Detail is needed on the timeline for when the scheme will be rolled out nationally, and what the criteria will be for those wishing to apply to purchase their home. 

www.twitter.com/RTBforHA
www.facebook.com/RTBforHA/
